Destroying the portrait also ends the effect immediately.

Critical Success The target is either @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}, depending on the punishment you chose. On a successful Will save, the condition value is 2, and the target is unaffected on a critical success.

Success The target is either @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, depending on the punishment you chose. On a successful Will save, the condition value is 1, and the target is unaffected on a critical success.

Failure The portrait doesn't change, and the ritual has no effect on the target.

Critical Failure The portrait turns into a sickening mimicry of your form and the forms of the secondary casters, and the blood of your target extracts itself from the canvas, dripping down and drying immediately to prevent you from reattempting the ritual. Over the course of the next 1d6 hours, you and the secondary casters experience the curse you had intended to place upon the target with the effects of a critical success.

entries.name: Portrait of the Artist
entries.description:
You change your appearance to look like a well-known artist talented at a particular craft or performance, such as a painter, singer, or orator, with the effects of illusory disguise. Additionally, you appear to mimic their skill, although such appearances are merely an illusion. If they are famous for physical art, the spell creates illusions of physical artwork matching their style, and onlookers who don't disbelieve are convinced these works are as impressive as the real thing. If they are famous for their ability to perform, you create an illusory performance that tricks onlookers into thinking you are as skillful as the performer you're pretending to be. The audience can disbelieve this spell if they interact with your art or actively listen to the performance, using either Perception or an appropriate Lore, whichever is higher. When the duration ends, any fake art disappears, and those who were duped by a performance realize it wasn't as good as they thought, though they still might not discover that you weren't really the artist you claimed to be.

This spell can't grant you any benefits from special abilities that take such skill they require a Performance check, such as the lingering performance focus spell. Using the spell to maintain the ruse long enough to Earn Income from your art is also quite difficult; because it requires careful timing and repeated deceit, it can't be assumed to automatically work on an Earn Income check.

entries.name: ポジティブ・アチューンメント
entries.description:
君はクリーチャーの正のエネルギー界に同調させ、完全に転送させることなくその生命力を接続する。クリーチャーの外見は、より鮮やかな色合いになる。もしそのクリーチャーが生きているクリーチャーなら、即座に、そして手番の終了ごとに1d8点のヒットポイントを回復する。治癒を増やす効果は、初期の治癒だけを増加させる。

もし、そのクリーチャーがアンデッドであるか、負のエネルギー治癒を持っているなら、意志セーヴの結果によって代わりに[[/r {1d8}[正のエネルギー]]]{1d8点の正のエネルギーダメージ}を受ける。

クリティカル クリーチャーは影響を受けない

成功 クリーチャーは呪文終了時に1度、ダメージを受ける

失敗 クリーチャーは即座に、そして君の手番の終了時ごとにダメージを受ける（君が「呪文の発動」をしたラウンドは2回、ダメージを受ける）

ファンブル 失敗と同じだが、ダメージは2倍になる

増強 (+3) ダメージと治癒は[[/r 1d8]]{1d8}点ずつ上昇する

entries.name: 正の輝き
entries.description:
君自身に生命力を引き込み、正のエネルギーの道しるべとなる。君は10フィート拡散の明るい光で輝き、内なる光の蓄積である、輝きの蓄積と呼ばれる蓄積を得る。この値は開始時、4である。君の手番の開始時ごとに、君は1回のフリーアクションを使って輝きの蓄積を4増やすことが出来る。そうしたなら、君の光の半径は10フィート増える。

もしアンデッド・クリーチャーが君の光の範囲内で君に攻撃をするか、呪文でダメージを与えたなら、そのクリーチャーは君の輝きの蓄積の半分に等しい正のエネルギーのダメージを受ける。

君はこの呪文を「解除」することが出来る。そうした際、君は君の光の中にいるクリーチャー1体を対象とし、正のエネルギーをその対象に直接、向けることが出来る。これは君の輝きの蓄積に等しい量のダメージをアンデッドに、回復を生きているクリーチャーに与える。

君が正の輝きを発動する際、君が既に効果を発揮させていた他の正の輝きは終了する。

増強(+1） 輝きの蓄積の初期値及び手番ごとに得る量は1ずつ増える。

entries.name: Possession
entries.description:
You send your mind and soul into the target's body, attempting to take control. The target must attempt a Will save. You can choose to use the effects of a degree of success more favorable to the target if you prefer. While you're possessing a target, your own body is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't wake up normally. You can sense everything the possessed target does. You can Dismiss this spell. If the possessed body dies, the spell ends and you must succeed at a Fortitude save against your spell DC or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 hour, or 24 hours on a critical failure. If the spell ends during an encounter, you act just before the possessed creature's initiative count.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success You possess the target but can't control it. You ride along in the body while the spell lasts.

Failure You possess the target and take partial control of it. You no longer have a separate turn; instead, you might control the target. At the start of each of the target's turns, it attempts another Will save. If it fails, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} by you on that turn; if it succeeds, it chooses its own actions; and if it critically succeeds, it forces you out and the spell ends.

Critical Failure You possess the target fully, and it can only watch as you manipulate it like a puppet. The target is Controlled by you.

増強 (9th) The duration is 10 minutes, and you can physically enter the creature's body, protecting your physical body while the spell lasts.

entries.name: Power Word Blind
entries.description:
You utter an arcane word of power that can make the target @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} upon hearing it. Once targeted, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. The effect of the spell depends on the target's level.

11th or Lower The target is Blinded permanently.

12th-13th The target is Blinded for [[/r 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

14th or Higher The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute.

増強 (+1) The levels at which each outcome applies increase by 2.

entries.name: Power Word Kill
entries.description:
You utter the most powerful arcane word of power. Once targeted, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. The effect of the spell depends on the target's level.

  • 14th or Lower The target dies instantly.
  • 15th If the target has 50 Hit Points or fewer, it dies instantly; otherwise, it drops to 0 Hit Points and becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying 1}, or increases its Dying condition by 1 if it's already Dying.
  • 16th or Higher The target takes 50 damage; if this brings the target to 0 Hit Points, the target dies instantly.

増強 (10th) The levels at which each outcome applies increase by 2.

entries.name: Power Word Stun
entries.description:
You stun the target with an arcane word of power. Once targeted, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

The effect of the spell depends on the target's level.

  • 13th or Lower The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for [[/r 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.
  • 14th-15th The target is Stunned for 1 round.
  • 16th or Higher The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

増強 (+1) The levels at which each outcome applies increase by 2.

entries.name: Powerful Inhalation
entries.description:
You rapidly draw the air from your surroundings, hoarding it for yourself. Creatures in the area when the spell is cast take 5d6 bludgeoning damage with a basic Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save can't speak above a raspy whisper for 1 round. A creature that critically fails can't speak or use abilities that require it to breathe for 1 round. This prevents it from using effects that require speech, such as casting spells with verbal components, and from using a breath weapon or similar ability.

Creatures made of air (such as air elementals) attempting a save against this spell get a degree of success one worse than they rolled.

増強 (+1) Increase the damage by 2d6.

entries.name: Practice Makes Perfect
entries.description:
Trigger You or an ally within range fails a skill check for a skill in which you or they are trained.

The target gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +3 bonus if the target has master or better proficiency in the skill. This bonus can change the outcome of the target's check.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.XMBoKRRyooKnGkHk]{Spell Effect: Practise Makes Perfect}

entries.name: 尊き金属
entries.description:
君の神格は基礎金属を祝福して貴金属へと変化させる。対象となっているアイテムは通常の金属から、冷たい鉄、銅、金、鉄、銀、鋼に変化する。この方法によって変化させられたアイテムは、新しい素材に応じたダメージを与える。例えば、冷たい鉄に変化した鋼の剣は、冷たい鉄の弱点を持つクリーチャーに追加ダメージを与えるだろう。この変化は明らかに魔法のものにして一時的であって、アイテムの金銭的価値は変化しない；君は何かを購入するためや、呪文の対価のために銅貨を金貨に変化させることは出来ない。

増強（8レベル） アダマンティンとミスラルを君がアイテムを変化させることの出来る金属の表に加える。

entries.name: Primal Call
entries.description: This functions as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{Planar Ally} except you craft a faerie circle and call an animal, beast, fey, fungus, or plant from within 100 miles.

entries.name: Primal Herd
entries.description:
Summoning the power of the natural world, you transform the targets into a herd of mammoths, and they each assume a Huge battle form. Each target must have enough space to expand into or the spell fails for that target. Each target gains the animal trait. Each target can Dismiss the spell's effects on themself. Each target gains the following while transformed:

  • AC = 22 + the target's level. Ignore any armor check penalty and Speed reduction.
  • 20 temporary Hit Points.
  • Speed 40 feet.
  • Low-light vision.
  • The following unarmed melee attacks, which are the only attacks the target can use. They're trained with them. When attacking with these attacks, the target uses their attack modifier with the proficiency and item bonuses of their most favorable weapon or unarmed Strike, and the damage is listed for each attack. These attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} condition, for example). If the target's unarmed attack modifier is higher, they can use it instead. Melee A tusk (reach 15 feet), Damage 4d8+19 piercing; Melee A trunk (agile, reach 15 feet), Damage 4d6+16 bludgeoning; Melee A foot (agile, reach 15 feet), Damage 4d6+13 bludgeoning.
  • Athletics modifier of +30, unless the target's own modifier is higher. T You move up to twice your Speed and move through the space of Large or smaller creatures, trampling each creature whose space you enter. A trampled creature takes damage from its foot Strike based on a basic Reflex save (DC = 19 + the target's level).

entries.name: Primal Phenomenon
entries.description:
You request a direct intercession from the natural world. Nature always refuses unnatural requests and might grant a different request (potentially more powerful or better fitting its character) than the one you asked for. A primal phenomenon spell can do any of the following things.

  • Duplicate any primal spell of 9th level or lower.
  • Duplicate any non-primal spell of 7th level or lower.
  • Produce any effect whose power level is in line with the above effects.
  • Reverse certain effects that refer to the wish spell.

At the GM's discretion, you can try to use primal phenomenon to produce greater effects than these, but doing so may be dangerous, or the spell may have only a partial effect.

entries.name: 始原の招来
entries.description:
君は招来したクリーチャーを元素の力で強化する。もし君の次のアクションが@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu]{サモン・アニマル}、@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.jSRAyd57kd4WZ4yE]{サモン・プラント・オア・ファンガス}であるなら、風、地、火、水から一つ選ぶ。君が招来したクリーチャーは対応する能力を得る。

  • @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.fwaAe71qfnK7SiOB]{風} クリーチャーは飛行速度60フィートを得る
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.Xl48OsJ47oDVZAVQ]{地} クリーチャーは掘り進み速度20フィートを得て、地上速度を10フィート減らし（最小値5フィート）、物理ダメージへの抵抗5を得る
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.blBXnWb1Y8q8YYMh]{火} クリーチャーの攻撃は1d6の追加の火炎ダメージを与え、クリーチャーは火炎への抵抗10と氷雪および水への弱点5を得る
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.TAAWbJgfESltn2we]{水} クリーチャーは水泳速度60フィートを得て、「押しやり」を試みるために、近接攻撃の後に1アクションを消費することが出来るようになり（複数回攻撃ペナルティを無視する）、火炎への抵抗5を得る

entries.name: Prismatic Armor
entries.description:
You wrap the target in armor made of multicolored light. It functions as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.NBSBFHxBm88qxQUy]{Chromatic Armor} that is all colors (granting resistance 5 to acid, electricity, fire, force, mental, poison, and sonic). An attacker that critically fails on its saving throw against the spell is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} rather than @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}.

増強 (9th) The resistances increase to 10 each.

entries.name: Prismatic Shield
entries.description:
Shield-sized shards of multicolored light manifest in the air around you, each rotating quickly to intercept attacks.

Melee attacks against you impact a randomly colored shard, subjecting the attacker to a random effect from @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, with a saving throw of the type indicated in that spell.

The shards automatically block physical ranged attacks the size of a spear or smaller, such as arrows, bolts, and javelins. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against attacks with larger ranged weapons.

Any spell that targets you requires the caster to succeed at a counteract check against your spell DC, or it fails to affect you.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.Pfllo68qdQjC4Qv6]{Spell Effect: Prismatic Shield}

entries.name: Prismatic Sphere
entries.description: You create a seven-layered sphere to protect an area. This multicolored sphere functions like a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.iL6TujgTCtRRa0Y0]{Prismatic Wall} but is shaped in a 10-foot burst centered on a corner of your space. You must form the sphere in an unbroken open space so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost.

entries.name: Prismatic Spray
entries.description:
A spray of rainbow light beams cascades from your open hand. Each creature in the area must roll 1d8 on the table below to see which beam affects it, then attempt a saving throw of the indicated type. The table notes any additional traits that apply to each type of ray. If a creature is struck by multiple beams, it uses the same d20 result for all its saving throws. For all rays, a successful saving throw negates the effect for that creature.

Prismatic Spray

1d8 Color Save Effects (Traits)
1 Red Reflex 50 fire damage (fire)
2 Orange Reflex 60 acid damage (acid)
3 Yellow Reflex 70 electricity damage (electricity)
4 Green Fortitude 30 poison damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute (poison)
5 Blue Fortitude Affected as if by @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Flesh to Stone}
6 Indigo Will Confused, as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8kJbiBEjMWG4VUjs]{Warp Mind} spell (mental)
7 Violet Will Slowed for 1 minute; if a critical failure, sent to another plane, as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Plane Shift} (teleportation)
8 Potent beam - Affected by two beams - roll twice, rerolling any duplicates or results of 8

entries.name: Prismatic Wall
entries.description:
You create an opaque wall of shimmering, multicolored light. The wall is straight and vertical, stretching 60 feet long and 30 feet high. You must form the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost. You can pass through the wall and ignore its effects. The wall sheds bright light out to 20 feet on each side (and dim light to the next 20 feet). Creatures other than you that come into the wall's light must attempt a Will save; they're @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round on a success, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round on a failure, and Blinded for 1 minute on a critical failure. They are then temporarily immune to the blinding effect for 1 hour.

A prismatic wall has seven different layers, each a different color. Red, orange, yellow, and green have the effect of a 5th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.forsqeofEszBNtLq]{Chromatic Wall} spell of that color, and the others have the effect of a 7th-level Chromatic Wall spell of that color. A creature that tries to pass through the wall must attempt a saving throw against each component wall. The effects take place simultaneously, so a creature turned to stone by the blue wall is still treated as a creature for the indigo and violet walls.

The wall as a whole is immune to counteracting effects of the wall's level or lower; each color must be counteracted by its specific spell, as described in chromatic wall. This must be done in order (red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, then violet). A given color can't be affected until the previous color is counteracted. Counteracting a color wall removes that color's effect from the wall, and counteracting them all ends prismatic wall. You can Dismiss the spell.

entries.name: Private Sanctum
entries.description: From outside, the area looks like a bank of impenetrable black fog. Sensory stimuli (such as sounds, smells, and light) don't pass from inside the area to outside the area. Scrying spells can't perceive any stimuli from the area, and mind-reading effects don't work in the area.

entries.name: Project Image
entries.description:
You project an illusory image of yourself. You must stay within range of the image, and if at any point you can't see the image, the spell ends. Whenever you Cast a Spell other than one whose area is an emanation, you can cause the spell effect to originate from either yourself or the image. Because the image is an illusion, it can't benefit from spells, though visual manifestations of the spell appear. The image has the same AC and saves as you. If it is hit by an attack or fails a save, the spell ends.

増強 (+2) The maximum duration you can Sustain the Spell increases to 10 minutes.

entries.name: Proliferating Eyes
entries.description:
You implant an @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, magical eye sensor on the target's body. The eye has sight and vision, but no other special senses. The eye is highly contagious-the first two times the target touches another creature during the duration, the spell buds off an additional eye that implants itself on that creature, which can then bud off two eyes of its own. This process can propagate up to four times from the original target, for a potential maximum of 31 eyes if each affected creature touches two new creatures.

You can switch between perceiving through your own senses or the vision of any of the eye sensors using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. You always know how many eyes there are and can tell which original eyes budded off to make which new eyes, though you gain no special insight into the identity of the new targets other than what you can glean from spying on them.

entries.name: プロテクト・コンパニオン
entries.description:
君は、幻獣や手下を守る魔法の盾のオーラを広げる。対象は次の手番の開始時まで、ACに+1状況ボーナスを得る。君は@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Iuq8CeNqv3a0oWfQ]{「生命防御」}を得る：リアクションを使った後、この呪文は終了し、君は10分間、プロテクト・コンパニオンを発動することが出来ない。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.pPMldkAbPVOSOPIF]{呪文効果: プロテクト・コンパニオン}

増強 (+2) リアクションはダメージを更に10点減らし、君は5点、更にヒット・ポイントにダメージを受ける。もし、ヒット・ポイント減少を減らしたいのなら、君は実際の呪文レベルを下げることなく、低レベルバージョンの呪文のヒット・ポイント減少とダメージ減少へと変更することが出来る。

entries.name: 守りの壁
entries.description:
君は防衛魔法による輝くオーラを放出する。君と範囲内にいる全ての味方はACに+1ステータス・ボーナスを得る。君が@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{「呪文の維持」}を行うごとに、拡散の半径は最大で30フィートまで5フィートずつ増加する。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.dWbg2gACxMkSnZag]{呪文効果: 守りの壁}

entries.name: プロテクター・ツリー
entries.description:
中型の木1つが突然、距離内の占有されていない空間に成長する。この木はAC10でヒット・ポイント10点である。木に隣接している味方1体が「打撃」の命中を受けたなら、この木はその枝を伸ばして先にダメージを受ける。木を0ヒット・ポイントにするのに使われた以上のダメージは、元々の対象に与えられる。この木はそのマス目を通り過ぎる移動を阻害するには大きさが不十分である。もし、この木が土壌についていて、この呪文の持続時間の終了時に生き残っているなら、この木は通常の、魔法の物ではない木として残り、生育と成長を続ける。GMは、生きるのに不適な状況では、木が即座に消えることにするかもしれない。

増強 (+1) 木は10点の追加のヒット・ポイントを持つ

entries.name: 守護者の犠牲
entries.description:
トリガー 30フィート以内の味方がダメージを受ける

君は味方の代わりに苦しむことによって味方を守る。トリガーとなった味方の受けるはずだったダメージを3点減らす。君はそのダメージを自分に転送するが、君の耐性、弱点、抵抗といったものは適用されない。君は君の味方にダメージを与えたものがなんであれ、その状態や他の効果の対象とならない（毒の噛みつきによる毒など）。たとえもし、君が全てのトリガーとなったダメージを自分への転送したとしてもな、君の味方はそれらの効果の対象である。

増強（+1） 君が転送するダメージは3増加する。

entries.name: 守護者のオーラ
entries.description:
守りのオーラが君から放たれ、君と君の味方の安全を守る。君は全てのダメージに抵抗3を得る。君の味方もまた、その範囲にいる間、この抵抗を得る。

増強（+1) 抵抗が1点上昇する。

entries.name: Prying Eye
entries.description: You create an @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, floating eye, 1 inch in diameter, at a location you can see within 500 feet. It sees in all directions with your normal visual senses and continuously transmits what it sees to you. The first time you Sustain the Spell each round, you can either move the eye up to 30 feet, seeing only things in front of the eye, or move it up to 10 feet, seeing everything in all directions around it. There is no limit to how far from you the eye can move, but the spell ends immediately if you and the eye ever cease to be on the same plane of existence. You can attempt Seek actions through the eye if you want to attempt Perception checks with it. Any damage dealt to the eye destroys it and ends the spell.

entries.name: Prying Survey
entries.description:
You create eight invisible, floating eyes, each about 3 inches in diameter, that scan the area around you, transmitting rough impressions of the environment. The eyes constantly examine and send you summaries of their findings. They are solid and can't move through barriers, and they don't follow routes that they fail to find while Searching. Any damage to an eye destroys it. When all eyes are destroyed, the spell ends.

As a single action, which has the concentrate trait, you can concentrate on a location within the area that an eye can reach. An eye travels to that location, and you Seek visually as if you were there. As an exploration activity, you can travel at half speed while continuing to concentrate on the eyes to gain the benefits of both the Scout and Search activities. With the eyes, you can check everything even if you are traveling faster than 300 feet per minute. The eyes use your Perception modifier. You can have only one prying survey in effect at a time.

増強 (10th) The area increases to a 500-foot emanation.

entries.name: パフ・オヴ・ポイズン
entries.description:
君は敵の顔に、有毒の吐息で出来た点滅する雲を吐き出す。対象は頑健セーヴの結果に応じて、君の呪文発動能力修正値に等しい毒ダメージと、[[/r {2}[継続、毒]]]点の@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{継続毒ダメージ}を受ける。

クリティカル 対象は影響を受けない

成功 対象は初期ダメージと継続ダメージを半分、受ける

失敗 対象は初期ダメージと継続ダメージを完全に受ける

ファンブル 対象は初期ダメージと継続ダメージを2倍、受ける

増強 (+2) 初期の毒ダメージは1d8点上昇し、継続毒ダメージは1点、増える。

entries.name: 都市の動脈
entries.description:
君は距離内の最も近い（いずれであれ）居住地の時代精神に触れる。君はその居住地の名前を知り、居住地で起こっている一つの重大な出来事の簡単な要約を知るために、特殊な言葉を発することが出来る。下記の言葉から一つを選ぶこと。この言葉は、関わる人々の種別や、君が知ることになる出来事の種別を示している。

  • 守護者 都市の守衛、弁護士、判事（犯罪報告、逮捕、日常生活での変化、法廷での裁判）
  • 称号を持つ者 貴族称号と政治家（上流社会の結婚、エリートの夜会、政治的集会）
  • 大衆 一般大衆と商人達（人々の集会、大きな特売）

言葉を発した際、君は既に知っている出来事を排除することが出来るが、それはこの呪文を通じて知ったものでも、他の体験を通じて知ったものでも構わない。もし君が24時間以内に再び、都市の脈動を発動したのなら、君は最後に「呪文の発動」をした時に学んだ出来事の最新情報を得るために、他の言葉ではなく、「エコー」と言うことが出来る。都市の動脈は、公に入手可能であるか、見ることが出来る情報しか明らかにしない。君は、秘密裏の動きや人々が特に隠そうとしている詳細を知ることは決してない。この呪文はまた、探知を避けるための魔法を克服することが非常に苦手である；

都市の動脈を妨げるか、無効化することが出来るような呪文の影響を受けている（@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{ノンディテクション}のような）クリーチャー、場所、物体に関わる出来事についての情報を明らかにする試みには自動的に失敗する。

増強（5レベル） 距離が100マイルまで増加する

entries.name: Pulverizing Cascade
entries.description:
You raise a pair of towering waves and slam them into each other, crushing creatures caught between them. Creatures in the area take 5d6 bludgeoning damage with a basic Reflex save.

増強 (+1) Increase the damage by 2d6.

entries.name: プメリング・ラブル
entries.description:
重たい岩の放射が君の正面で空気中を飛んでくる。瓦礫は範囲内のそれぞれのクリーチャーに[[/r {2d4}[殴打]]]{2d4点の殴打ダメージ}を与える。それぞれのクリーチャーは反応せーヴを試みなくてはならない。

クリティカル クリーチャーは影響を受けない

成功 クリーチャーは半分のダメージを受ける

失敗 クリーチャーは完全なダメージを受け、君から5フィート押しのけられる

ファンブル クリーチャーは2倍のダメージを受け、君から10フィート押しのけられる

増強 (+1) ダメージを2d4点、増加させる

entries.name: Punishing Winds
entries.description: Violent winds and a powerful downdraft fill the area, forming a cyclone. All flying creatures in the area descend 40 feet. The entire area is greater difficult terrain for Flying creatures, and difficult terrain for creatures on the ground or Climbing. Any creature that ends its turn Flying within the area descends 20 feet. Any creature pushed into a surface by this spell's winds takes bludgeoning damage as though it had fallen. The squares at the outside vertical edges of the cylinder prevent creatures from leaving. These squares are greater difficult terrain, and a creature attempting to push through must succeed at an Athletics check or Acrobatics check to Maneuver in Flight against your spell DC to get through. A creature that fails ends its current action but can try again.

entries.name: Purify Soul Path
entries.description:
You delve inward, spending extensive time contemplating the purity of your own soul and the actions of your past. If you aren't truly penitent, the outcome is always a critical failure.

Critical Success You reconcile your misdeeds with your soul path, removing your soulforged corruption. The corruption flaw from your armament no longer affects you. Before your reconciliation is complete, you must perform a special quest or other task in accord with your soul path. If completed during downtime, this task should take no less than 1 week. For 1 month, you receive divine insight just before performing an act that would be anathema to your soul path.

Success As critical success, but you gain no special insight regarding its subsequent actions.

Failure You don't reconcile and must continue to meditate and redress your misdeeds. Any future purify soul path rituals for the same misdeeds cost half as much and gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the primary check.

増強 (+1) Increase the maximum target level by 2 and the base cost by 10 gp.

entries.name: Purple Worm Sting
entries.description:
You replicate the attack of a deadly purple worm. You deal 3d6 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict it with purple worm venom. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes 3d6 poison damage.

Failure The target is afflicted with purple worm venom at stage 1.

Critical Failure The target is afflicted with purple worm venom at stage 2.

Purple Worm Venom (poison)

Level 11

Maximum Duration 6 rounds.

Stage 1 [[/r {3d6}[poison]]]{3d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {4d6}[poison]]]{4d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {6d6}[poison]]]{6d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round).

entries.name: 突風
entries.description:
風を押しやることによって、君は強力な突風で対象を打ちつける；対象は頑健セーヴを試みなくてはならない。

クリティカル 対象は影響を受けない

成功 対象は君から5フィート押しやられる

失敗 対象は君から10フィート押しやられる

ファンブル 対象は君から10フィート押しやられ、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{伏せ状態}となる

entries.name: ピュトリファイ・フード・アンド・ドリンク
entries.description:
君は、食べることが出来る食料を即座に腐らせ、だめにし、水やその他の液体を塩辛くて飲めない状態にする。@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.efFe4EK7ThUrH446]{聖水}、@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.uplCUQwMwBOBHz0E]{不浄の水}、そして似たような重要な食料や飲み物は、それらが衰退や穢れの神格に関連するものでない限り、この呪文によってだめになる。だが、この呪文はあらゆる種別のクリーチャー、ポーション、錬金術エリクサーに効果を持たない。1フィート立方の液体は概ね8ガロンである。

増強 (2nd) 君はこの呪文で錬金術エリクサーを対象とし、無効化判定を試みることが出来る。もし成功したなら、エリクサーはだめになって通常のアイテムになる

増強 (3rd) 君はこの呪文でポーションや錬金術エリクサーを対象とし、無効化判定を試みることが出来る。もし成功したなら、エリクサーやポーションはだめになって通常のアイテムになる

entries.name: パイロテクニクス
entries.description:
君は「呪文の発動」の際に一つの炎を目も眩むような花火にするか、息が詰まるような煙にするかを選ぶ。この呪文は一つの炎の源を対象とする。この火元は、もし、キャンプファイア以下の大きさの魔法のものではない炎なら、即座に消火される。もし、火元がクリーチャーであるなら、そのクリーチャーは1d6点の氷雪ダメージを受け、消火されない。

  • 花火 対象となった火は20フィート半径に爆発する、色とりどりの眩しい、燃え上がりながら成長する空中の花火を爆発させる。君が毎ラウンド、「呪文の維持」を最初にするごとに、君は花火の範囲を20フィートまで上昇させることが出来るが、その範囲を横方向に移動させることは出来ない。自分の手番を花火の範囲内で開始したクリーチャーは頑健セーヴを試みなくてはならず、それから1分間、一時的完全耐性を得る。

    クリティカル クリーチャーは影響を受けない

    成功 クリーチャーは次の手番の終了時まで@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{目が眩んだ状態}になる

    失敗 クリーチャーは次の手番の終了時まで@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{盲目状態}になる

    ファンブル クリーチャーは1分間、盲目状態になる

  • 煙の雲 火元から濃い煙が吹き出し、雲となってまとまり、対象となった火を中心とした半径20フィート爆発の範囲を埋め尽くすように広がる。煙の雲の中に居るクリーチャーは視覚的な知覚判定に－4の状況ペナルティを受け、煙の雲の外側に居るクリーチャーは煙の雲の中にいるクリーチャーや物体を探知するための視覚的な知覚判定に－4の状況ペナルティを受ける。毎ラウンド、最初に君が「呪文の維持」をするごとに、君は20フィートまで煙の雲を下降させることが出来るが、その範囲を横方向に移動させることは出来ない。自分の手番を煙の雲の中で開始したクリーチャーは頑健セーヴを試みなくてはならず、それから1分間、一時的完全耐性を得る。

    成功 クリーチャーは影響を受けない

    失敗 クリーチャーは @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{不調1}になる

    ファンブル クリーチャーは不調1になり、煙の雲の範囲内にいる間は不調から回復することが出来ない

entries.name: クェンチ
entries.description:
君は範囲内の大気を水の蒸気で過飽和にする。範囲内の魔法のものでない炎は自動的に消火される。範囲内の火炎クリーチャーは[[/r 4d8]]点のダメージを受ける（基本頑健セーヴ）。範囲内の、一つの魔法の炎、火炎呪文、あるいは火炎アイテムを選び、それを無効化しようとすること。もし君がアイテムに対して成功したなら、そのアイテムは10分間、火炎属性を失う（例えば、+1 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{フレイミング} @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]{ロングソード} は+1 ロングソードになる）。もし対象がアーティファクトや似たようなアイテムであれば、君は自動的に無効化に失敗する。

君がこの@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{「呪文の維持」}をした際、君は範囲内の蒸気の範囲を移動させることが出来るが、君がそうした際の唯一の効果は、自動的に魔法のものではない炎を消火することである。

もし君が『呪文無効化』のリアクションを持っているのなら、君はレパートリーあるいは準備済み呪文にトリガーとなった火炎呪文を持つことなく、火炎の特性を持ついかなる呪文を無効化するためにもクェンチを使うことが出来る。

増強 (+1) 火炎クリーチャーへのダメージを[[/r 2d8]]点上昇させる。

entries.name: クィック・ソート
entries.description:
君は魔法できっちりと積み上げた山へと物体を分類する。君は物体を2つの異なる方法で分類することが出来る。最初の選択肢は、色や形と言った簡単に観察可能な要素に基づいて別々の山に振り分けるやり方である。代わりに、君は、ページ数、タイトル、日付といった、はっきりと書かれていることに基づいて山を順番に分類することが出来る。持続時間の間中、物体は自ら分類されていくが、少ない物体を分類するのにかかる時間は少ないので、30個以下の物体は1ラウンドで済む。

増強 (3rd) 呪文は1分間に400個の物体を、1ラウンドで60個の物体を分類することが出来る

増強 (5th) 呪文は1分間に800個の物体を、1ラウンドで120個の物体を分類することが出来る

entries.name: 激震掌
entries.description:
近接素手「打撃」を1回行うこと。もし命中して、かつ、対象が生きているなら、持続時間の間、いつでも、君は聴覚と精神集中の特性を持つ単一アクションを消費して、即座に対象を殺すことの出来る死の言葉をはっs留ことが出来る。対象は頑健セーヴを試みなくてはならない。

もし君が再び激震掌を発動するなら、前に発動していた激震掌の全ての効果が終了する。

クリティカル 対象は生き残り、呪文は終了し、それから24時間、対象は一時的に耐性を得る

成功 対象は@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{朦朧1}になり、40点のダメージを受け、呪文は終了し、それから24時間、対象は一時的に耐性を得る

失敗 対象は@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{朦朧3}になり、80点のダメージを受ける。呪文の持続時間は継続するが、それから24時間、対象は激震掌で殺されることに対する一時的な耐性を得る

ファンブル 対象は死亡する

増強（+1） 失敗時のダメージは10、成功時のダメージが5増加する

entries.name: ラディアント・フィールド
entries.description:
君は眩しい光の範囲を作り出す。@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{光への脆弱性}があり、ラディアント・フィールドによって盲目になるクリーチャーが範囲内に残っているなら、手番の開始時に頑健セーヴを試みなくてはならない。失敗した際、クリーチャーは1ラウンド、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{盲目}のままである；これは無力化効果である。

この呪文はまた、君のラディアント・フィールドの呪文レベル以下の魔法の暗闇を抑制する。

増強 (4th) この範囲を見通して目撃されたクリーチャーは、たとえ範囲の外側にいようと、光への脆弱性があるクリーチャーにとって@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{視認困難}となる。

entries.name: Raga of Remembrance
entries.description:
You scribe occult symbols on unblighted Vudran ground, laying the ceramics within them to create a ritual space. To perform the ritual, light incense in the ceramics and sit at the center of the ritual space. You then play the disharmonic instrument, drawing on musical skill, occult harmonics, or religious tradition. This establishes an underlying drone atop which the secondary casters layer their own performances. The song calls to the millions who died defending Vudra from Kothogaz, investing their power in Vanitapati, the legendary psychic.

Critical Success A towering, ethereal avatar of Vanitapati manifests around you, surrounded by swirling spirits. The avatar weakens Kothogaz's spirit. While Kothogaz is within 1 mile of you, it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and is permanently destroyed if reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Success As critical success, but Kothogaz is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The dead come to your aid, but their presence is unnerving. As success, but Kothogaz isn't frightened, and the primary and secondary casters take a -1 status penalty to saving throws against emotion effects.

Critical Failure Rather than the dead, Kothogaz hears the ritual's call and immediately teleports to the primary caster with its Disharmonic Door ability. Primary and secondary casters are afflicted with many-eyed blight.

entries.name: Raise Dead
entries.description:
You attempt to call forth the dead creature's soul, requiring the creature's body to be present and relatively intact. The creature must have died within the past 3 days. If Pharasma has decided that the creature's time has come (at the GM's discretion), or if the creature doesn't wish to return to life, this spell automatically fails, but the diamonds aren't consumed in the casting.

If the spell is successful, the creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point, no spells prepared or spell slots available, no points in any pools or any other daily resources, and still with any long-term debilitations of the old body. The time spent in the Boneyard leaves the target temporarily debilitated, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 week; these conditions can't be removed or reduced by any means until the week has passed. The creature is also permanently changed by its time in the afterlife, such as a slight personality shift, a streak of white in the hair, or a strange new birthmark.

増強 (7th) The maximum level of the target increases to 15. The cost increases to the target's level (minimum 1) × 400 gp.

増強 (8th) The maximum level of the target increases to 17. The cost increases to the target's level (minimum 1) × 800 gp.

増強 (9th) The maximum level of the target increases to 19. The cost increases to the target's level (minimum 1) × 1,600 gp.

増強 (10th) The maximum level of the target increases to 21. The cost increases to the target's level (minimum 1) × 3,200 gp.

entries.name: Ranger's Bramble
entries.description:
範囲　5フィート爆発以内の全てのマス目に植物がある範囲

君は範囲内の植物を@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{エンタングル}の効果でもって敵に絡みつかせる。

このセーヴにファンブルしたクリーチャーは@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{動けない状態}になるのに加えて、[[/r {2d4}[継続、出血]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{継続出血ダメージ}を受ける。君の低木から@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{「脱出」}しても出血ダメージは終わらない。

増強ｚ (+1) ファンブル時の[[/r {1d4}[継続、出血]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{継続出血ダメージ}が1d4点増える。

entries.name: ラピッド・アダプテイション
entries.description:
君は何世紀にもわたる進化を一瞬にして凝縮したような、周囲の地形からのエネルギーを対象に浴びせる。対象は周囲の環境に応じて、以下の自然の適応のうち1つを得る。

  • 水中 対象は地上速度に等しい水泳速度を得る。もし、既に水泳速度を持っているなら、水泳速度に+10フィートのステータス・ボーナスを得る。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.fGK6zJ7mWz9D5QYo]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (水中：基本水泳速度)} or @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.itmiGioGNuVvt4QE]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (水中：速度ボーナス)}
  • 極地 対象は深刻な、あるいは極限の冷気に影響されず、氷や雪の上で「バランスを取る」ための〈軽業〉に成功をロールしたなら、代わりにクリティカルする。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.iiV80Kexj6vPmzqU]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (極地)}
  • 砂漠 対象は深刻な、あるいは極限の暑さに影響されず、砂の上で「バランスを取る」ための〈軽業〉に成功をロールしたなら、代わりにクリティカルする。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.qo7DoF11Xl9gqmFc]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (砂漠)}
  • 森林 対象は距離30フィートの不明瞭な感覚として嗅覚を得る。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.jtMo6qS47hPx6EbR]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (森林)}
  • 山地 対象は「登攀」中に@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{立ちすくみ}にならず、瓦礫の上で「バランスを取る」ための〈軽業〉に成功をロールしたなら、代わりにクリティカルする。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.sDN9b4bjCGH2nQnG]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (山地)}
  • 平地 対象は地上速度に+10フィートのステータス・ボーナスを得る。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.AM49w68oKykc2fHI]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (平地)}
  • 地下 対象は暗視を得る。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.0q2716S34XL1y9Hh]{呪文効果: ラピッド・アダプテイション (地下)}

entries.name: Ravening Maw
entries.description:
You evoke Zevgavizeb's unceasing hunger and inflict it upon your target. The target becomes overwhelmed with cannibalistic hunger and can restore its vitality by feasting on the flesh of the fallen. On its turn, the target can use 2 actions (these actions have the manipulate trait) to cannibalize an adjacent @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} or dead creature. If the cannibalized creature is Dying, it dies. If the cannibalized creature is an ally of the target, the target regains 5d8 HP; otherwise, the target regains 5d4 HP. Certain monsters (such as those whose blood is acidic or magical) might inflict additional effects on those who cannibalize them at the GM's discretion. Once cannibalized, a particular creature's body doesn't have enough meat to cannibalize again. During any round that there's a Dying or dead creature within 30 feet of the target, if the target can't or doesn't cannibalize a creature, the target takes 5d4 mental damage.

増強 (+1) The amount of HP restored by cannibalizing a creature increases by 1d8 for eating an ally and 1d4 otherwise, and the mental damage increases by 1d4.

entries.name: Ravenous Portal
entries.description:
You place a ward upon the door that triggers when a creature attempts to open, unlock, or destroy the door. When that happens, the door transforms into a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Br1AtKUHe3nbzjnY]{Mimic} that can't move and is hostile to all creatures. When Casting the Spell, you designate yourself and up to 10 other creatures of your choice; these creatures don't trigger the ward, and the mimic is helpful to them instead of hostile. No effect can move the mimic unless it's also capable of moving the entire door. Once the door transforms into a mimic, it attacks creatures in its reach for up to 1 minute, and then the spell ends. If the mimic is killed before that time, the spell ends and the door returns to its normal form.

While turned into a mimic, the door can't be opened, unlocked, or bypassed-not even by the designated creatures. It's a creature, not a door, during that time. When the spell ends, the door returns to the state it was in before the ward was triggered.

entries.name: Ravenous Reanimation
entries.description:
You destroy the gathered treasures with your breath weapon or other powerful magic, then invoke necromantic energies before you feed upon the charred and melted remains. As you do so, negative energy courses through your flesh, automatically killing you. Each individual ravener's ravenous reanimation requires three to five unique additional components. Whether or not you return as a ravener depends on the success of the ritual.

Critical Success You immediately transform into a ravener upon finishing the ritual; your soul ward starts at full Hit Points (equal to 5 × your level).

Success You rise as a ravener 24 hours after completing the ritual, as long as your body remains relatively intact. When you rise as a ravener, your soul ward starts at 1 Hit Point.

Failure You rise as a ravener husk 24 hours after completing the ritual.

Critical Failure You die.

entries.name: 未来予知
entries.description:
君は、短期間内の、ほとんどの単調なクリーチャーについては翌日以内、あるいは積極的に冒険しているような、複数回のテンポ良い経験を得る可能性が高い者については一時間以内の、対象の運命についてより多くを知ろうとする。

君はその時間の枠組み内の、そのクリーチャーの運命と関連する一つの暗号めいた言葉を知る。運命とは悪名高くも不可解なものであって、その言葉は必ずしも額面通りに受け取る必要がないため、意味は後から初めて明らかになるということもしばしばである。GMは非公開のDC6の平目判定をロールする。もしそのクリーチャーの運命があまりに蓋しかであるか、平目判定に失敗したなら、この呪文は「結論不明」という言葉をもたらす。いずれにせよ、そのクリーチャーは24時間、一時的耐性を持つ。

entries.name: Read Omens
entries.description: You peek into the future. Choose a particular goal or activity you plan to engage in within 1 week, or an event you expect might happen within 1 week. You learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, often in the form of a rhyme or omen.

entries.name: リード・ジ・エア
entries.description:
社交的な状況を確認しながら君は深い溜息をつき、周囲の人々に礼儀を示しながら、社会的背景や暗黙の前提となっている行動の手がかりを直感的に素早く把握する。君のボディランゲージは無意識のうちに変化し、その情報を利用してクリーチャーとの交流に役立てる。

この「呪文の発動」の一部として、君はその場の社交的な状況について情報を得るため、〈社会〉を使って「知識を思い出す」を行う。君はまた、その判定が呪文の持続時間に起きる限り、呪文の発動の際にその場に居たクリーチャーに「懐柔」を行うための次の〈交渉〉判定に、+1ステータス・ボーナスを得る。君は、ある社交的な状況について、1度だけ、リード・ジ・エアを使うことが出来る；再度の発動には何の効果も無い。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.a3uZckqOY9zQWzZ2]{呪文効果: リード・ジ・エア}

entries.name: リーパーズ・ランタン
entries.description:
君は、生者を死に向けて案内し、アンデッドを真の死に向けて案内する幽霊めいたランタンを生じさせる。このランタンは呪文の範囲を明るい光で、その2倍の範囲を薄暗い光で照らす。ランタンは実体を持たないが、君はそれを保つために一本の手を自由にしておかなければ、呪文が終了してしまう（だが、その手を呪文の動作要素として用いても呪文は終了しない）。君が@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{「呪文の発動」}をした際に範囲内にいたか、後でその範囲に入った、生きているクリーチャーとアンデッドは、頑健セーヴを試みなくてはならない。頑健セーヴに失敗した生きているクリーチャーは、範囲内にいる限り、治癒効果から通常の利益の半分しか得られない。頑健セーヴに失敗したアンデッドの対象は範囲内にいる限り、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{衰弱1}である。クリーチャーがリーパーズ・ランタンに対するセーヴを一度試みたなら、そのクリーチャーは範囲を去ってから再び入ったとしても、同じ結果を用いる。

手番に一度、君がリーパーズ・ランタンを発動した後の手番の開始時に、君は、精神集中の特性を持つ単発アクションを用いて、拡散の半径を5フィート、増やすことが出来る。そうした際に、君はリーパーズ・ランタンへのセーヴをまだ試みていない、範囲内のクリーチャーにセーヴをさせる。

entries.name: Rebounding Barrier
entries.description:
You swiftly raise a reflective barrier, reducing physical damage and rebounding it onto your attacker. You gain resistance 10 against one physical damage type the triggering attack deals. Your attacker takes 5 damage of the same type.

増強 (+1) The resistance increases by 2. Damage dealt to your attacker increases by 1.

entries.name: 死への戒め
entries.description:
君は死のあぎとからクリーチャーを奪い取る。君はこの“呪文の発動”のために1アクションから3アクションまでを消費することが出来て、消費したアクション数に等しい数のクリーチャーを対象にすることが出来る。それぞれの対象あ3d6のヒット・ポイントを回復する。もしその対象が瀕死状態だったなら、この治癒によって@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{瀕死}から戻ることによって@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{負傷}状態が増えることはない。

増強（+1） 治癒を1d6増加させる。

entries.name: Redact
entries.description:
You strike mention of a specific name from one or more documents. When you cast the spell, give one proper name, be it a creature, location, or object. Any mention of that name within the document becomes blurred, smudged, or otherwise completely illegible. Epithets and unambiguous references to the name are redacted as well; for instance, redacting the name of the goddess @Compendium[pf2e.deities.BNycwu3I21dTh4D9]{Sarenrae} from a book would also remove references to her title "the Dawnflower."

増強 (3rd) Instead of striking out a given name, you can replace it with a different name you choose. Epithets and references are substituted with similar ones relating to the replacement name. Anyone reading the text can attempt a Perception or Society check against your spell DC to notice the altered text, though that doesn't tell them what the original said.

増強 (4th) At your choice, the duration is unlimited.

entries.name: Reflective Scales
entries.description:
You grow a set of colored glowing scales or scaled armor that stores energy before releasing it in a final burst. When you cast this spell, choose acid, cold, fire, electricity, or poison damage. You gain resistance 5 against that type of damage. The scales' color depends on the damage type you chose and is usually the color of a type of dragon or other creature associated with that damage type, such as red or gold for fire damage.

The scales store up energy as they protect you. Keep track of how much damage the scales have prevented. As a 2-action activity that has the concentrate and manipulate traits, you can explode your scales outward in a 20-foot radius around you, dealing 1d6 damage of the chosen type to all creatures in the area for every 10 damage the scales have prevented, to a maximum of 10d6 damage (after preventing 100 damage). Once you do so, the spell ends.

増強 (+2) The resistance increases by 5 and the maximum damage from the scale explosion increases by 5d6.

entries.name: Regenerate
entries.description:
An infusion of positive energy grants a creature continuous healing. The target temporarily gains regeneration 15, which restores 15 Hit Points to it at the start of each of its turns. While it has regeneration, the target can't die from damage and its @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition can't increase to a value that would kill it (this stops most creatures from going beyond dying 3), though if its @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} value becomes 4 or higher, it stays @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} until its wounds are treated. If the target takes acid or fire damage, its regeneration deactivates until after the end of its next turn. Each time the creature regains Hit Points from regeneration, it also regrows one damaged or ruined organ (if any). During the spell's duration, the creature can also reattach severed body parts by spending an Interact action to hold the body part to the area it was severed from.

増強 (9th) The regeneration increases to 20.

entries.name: Reincarnate
entries.description:
You call forth the target's soul and attempt to incarnate it into a brand-new body. As the soul won't be returning to the original body, only a small portion of the creature's remains are required.

These remains must have been part of the original body at the time of death, and the target must have died within the past week. If Pharasma has decided that the target's time has come or the target's soul is trapped or doesn't wish to return, this ritual automatically fails, but you discover this after you succeed at the Religion check and can end the ritual without paying the cost.

If the ritual is successful, the target's new body has a random ancestry. First roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a result of 1 through 14, the new body is one of a common ancestry, while on a 15 through 20 they become a member of an uncommon or rare ancestry. The GM chooses possible ancestries based on those found in the region and then rolls randomly between them. For instance, the GM could roll [[/r 1d6]] to choose a common ancestry from the Core Rulebook. The target replaces their ancestry Hit Points, size, Speeds, ability boosts, ability flaws, traits, and special abilities with those of their new ancestry. The target loses their heritage and ancestry feats, selecting replacements from their new ancestry. The target's background, class features, and known languages remain unaltered.

Critical Success You reincarnate the target into a new adult body. This new body has full HP and has the same spells prepared and points in their pools as the original did when it died.

Success As critical success, except the new body has 1 HP and no spells prepared or points in any pools. The soul takes some time to adjust to their new body, leaving them @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 week; these conditions can't be removed or reduced by any means until the week has passed.

Failure You fail to reincarnate the target.

Critical Failure The target's soul becomes trapped in an unintelligent animal creature of the GM's choosing, with a level no greater than half the target's level. While trapped, the target has an Intelligence score of 1 (-5 modifier) and can't use any of their own abilities.

増強 (4th) The maximum level of the target increases to 10. The cost is the target's level (minimum 1) × 40 gp.

増強 (5th) The maximum level of the target increases to 12. The cost is the target's level (minimum 1) × 75 gp.

増強 (6th) The maximum level of the target increases to 14. The cost is the target's level (minimum 1) × 125 gp. The target must have died within the past month.

増強 (7th) The maximum level of the target increases to 16. The cost is the target's level (minimum 1) × 200 gp. The target must have died within the past month.

増強 (8th) The maximum level of the target increases to 18. The cost is the target's level (minimum 1) × 300 gp. The target must have died within the past year.

増強 (9th) The maximum level of the target increases to 20. The cost is the target's level (minimum 1) × 600 gp. The target must have died within the past decade.

entries.name: 幻獣強化
entries.description:
君は自分と幻獣との繋がりに深く集中し、幻獣の防御能力を強化する。君の幻獣はACとセーヴィング・スローに+1ステータス・ボーナスと、更に、この呪文のレベルの半分に等しい、あらゆるダメージへの抵抗を得る。君の幻獣は@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HStu2Yhw3iQER9tY]{幻獣増幅}と幻獣強化のどちらかから利益を得ることが出来るが、両方から利益を得ることは出来ない；もし、君が片方の持続時間中にもう片方を発動したなら、新しい呪文が古い呪文を置き換える。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.UVrEe0nukiSmiwfF]{呪文効果: 幻獣強化}

entries.name: 再生の炎
entries.description:
君は治癒と炎の双方を兼ね備えた炎の噴出を作り出す。君は範囲内の全ての味方のヒットポイントを[[/r {1d4}[治癒]]]{1d4 ヒット・ポイント}回復させ、これらの味方は1分間、+1ステータス・ボーナスを頑健セーヴに得る。範囲内の敵は基本反応セーヴで[[/r {1d4}[火炎]]]{1d4点の火炎ダメージ}を受ける。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.06zdFoxzuTpPPGyJ]{呪文効果: 再生の炎}

増強 (+1) 君は味方のヒットポイントを追加で[[/r 1d4]]点回復し、敵に追加の[[/r {1d4}[火炎]]]{1d4点の火炎ダメージ}を与える。

entries.name: Remake
entries.description:
You fully re-create an object from nothing, even if the object was destroyed. To do so, you must be able to picture the object in your mind. Additionally, the material component must be a remnant of the item, no matter how small or insignificant (even a speck of dust that remains from disintegrate is enough). The spell fails if your imagination relied on too much guesswork; if the object would be too large to fit in a 5-foot cube; if the object still exists and you were simply not aware of it; or if the object is an artifact, has a level over 20, or has similar vast magical power.

The item reassembles in perfect condition. Even if your mental image was of a damaged or weathered object, the new one is in this perfected form. If the object was magical, this spell typically restores its constant magical properties, but not any temporary ones, such as charges or one-time uses. An item with charges or uses per day has all of its uses expended when remade, but it replenishes them normally thereafter.

entries.name: Remember the Lost
entries.description:
You call upon the lost and forgotten, assailing your foes' minds with the memories of those who died with a grievance toward them. Enemies in the area take 6d6 mental damage (basic Will save) and are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} on a critical failure. If you know the names of anyone murdered or grievously wronged by an enemy in the area, you can chant those victims' names when you cast the spell to improve the clarity of the visions, increasing the damage to the corresponding enemy from 6d6 to 6d10; you can do so for multiple enemies if you know victims of each enemy. The visions are personal to each foe in the area, and you can't use this spell to discern a murderer by guessing a name. A creature that truly knows no one who died with any sort of grievance to that creature is immune to this effect.

増強 (+1) The damage increases by 2d6 (or 2d10 to an enemy when you name a specific victim).

entries.name: Remove Curse
entries.description: Your touch grants a reprieve to a cursed creature. You attempt to counteract one curse afflicting the target. If the curse comes from a cursed item or other external source, a success indicates that the target creature can rid itself of the cursed item, but it doesn't remove the curse from the item.

entries.name: リムーヴ・ディジーズ
entries.description: 治癒の魔術がクリーチャーの肉体から病気を追い出す。君は、対象を苛んでいる1つの病気を無効化しようとする。

entries.name: リムーヴ・フィアー
entries.description:
接触によって、君はクリーチャーの恐怖を和らげる。君は対象を苦しめている一つの恐怖効果の無効化を試みることが出来る。これはその対象のみを解放し、恐怖効果を受けている他のクリーチャーを解放することはない。

増強 (6th) 呪文の距離は30フィートに増加し、君は10体までのクリーチャーを対象にすることが出来る。

entries.name: リムーヴ・パラリシス
entries.description:
エネルギーの活性が@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痺}しているクリーチャーを自由にする。君は対象に麻痺状態を与えている一つの効果を無効化するよう試みることが出来る。これによって魔法のものでない傷や毒などの自然状態あるいは効果によって麻痺している者を癒すことは出来ない。

増強 (6th) 呪文の距離は30フィートに増加し、君は10体までのクリーチャーを対象に取ることが出来る。

entries.name: Repelling Pulse
entries.description:
You unleash a powerful pulse of telekinetic power, and the pulse violently hurls creatures away from you. Each creature in the area takes 7d10 force damage depending on its Reflex save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. The creature is pushed 20 feet away from you and is then knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

増強 (+2) The force damage increases by 2d10, and the distance the target is moved on a failure and critical failure increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Replicate
entries.description:
You create an illusory magical double that physically looks and behaves very similarly to the target. This double is limited to moving, Interacting, speaking short sentences, and other similar basic tasks. It is unable to cast spells, attack, or use any complex skills.

The illusory duplicate is your minion. You can issue new commands to the double as part of Sustaining the Spell. You can command the duplicate telepathically as long as the spell lasts, provided it's within 1 mile of you. You can switch between using your own senses and the duplicate's senses with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. The illusory duplicate has the same statistics as the original creature, except it doesn't have any of the original's item bonuses, and it has one quarter of the original's Hit Points. If the double's Hit Points are reduced to 0, the spell ends.

増強 (+1) The maximum level of the target increases by 2.

entries.name: Repulsion
entries.description:
You manifest an aura that prevents creatures from approaching you. When casting the spell, you can make the area any radius you choose, up to 40 feet. A creature must attempt a Will save if it's within the area when you cast the spell or as soon as it enters the area while the spell is in effect. Once a creature has attempted the save, it uses the same result for that casting of repulsion. Any restrictions on a creature's movement apply only if it voluntarily moves toward you. For example, if you move closer to a creature, it doesn't then need to move away.

Critical Success The creature's movement is not restricted.

Success The creature treats each square in the area as difficult terrain when moving closer to you.

Failure The creature can't move closer to you within the area.

entries.name: Resilient Sphere
entries.description:
You create an immobile sphere of force to either trap or protect the target, blocking anything that would pass through the sphere. The sphere has AC 5, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points. It's immune to critical hits and precision damage. Disintegrate destroys the sphere instantly. If the target is unwilling, the effects of the sphere depend on the target's Reflex save.

Critical Success The target disrupts the sphere's integrity, causing it to collapse entirely.

Success The sphere functions normally but has only 10 Hit Points instead of 40.

Failure The sphere has its normal effect.

entries.name: レジスト・エナジー
entries.description:
エレメンタルのエネルギーで出来た盾がクリーチャーを一種類のエネルギーダメージに対して守る。強酸、氷雪、電撃、火炎、音波ダメージから一つを選ぶこと。対象とその装備は君が選んだダメージ種別に対して抵抗5を得る。

増強 (4th) 抵抗は10に増加し、君は2体までのクリーチャーを対象にすることが出来る

増強 (7th) 抵抗は15に増加し、君は5体までのクリーチャーを対象にすることが出来る

entries.name: Resplendent Mansion
entries.description:
You conjure a towering mansion up to four stories tall and up to 300 feet on a side. While Casting the Spell, you hold an image of the mansion and its desired appearance in your mind. The mansion can contain as many or as few rooms as you desire, and it is decorated as you imagine it. You can imagine a purpose for each room of the mansion, and the proper accouterments appear within. Any furniture or other mundane fixtures function normally for anyone inside the mansion, but they cease to exist if taken beyond its walls. No fixture created with this spell can create magical effects, but magical devices brought into the mansion function normally.

Your mansion contains the same types and quantities of foodstuffs and servants as created by the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vPWMEyVTreMOoFnm]{Magnificent Mansion} spell.

Each of the mansion's exterior doorways and windows are protected by @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4WAib3GichxLjp5p]{Alarm} spells. You choose whether each alarm is audible or mental as you Cast the Spell, and each has a different sound (for an audible alarm) or sensation (for a mental one), allowing you to instantly determine which portal has been used.

entries.name: Rest Eternal
entries.description:
You call upon gods, spirits, and stranger beings to bar a creature's spirit from ever returning. A spirit that doesn't wish to be so constrained can attempt a Will save to resist this ritual; on a critical success, it fools you into believing the ritual succeeded. This ritual has no effect on a target who is undead or whose soul is otherwise not in the afterlife.

Critical Success You sequester the subject's spirit to the afterlife. Attempts to communicate with the dead creature, return it to life, turn it into an undead, or otherwise disturb its afterlife fail unless the effect's counteract level is at least 2 higher than that of rest eternal or originates from an artifact or a deity. Successfully returning the creature to life ends the restrictions placed by rest eternal.

Success As critical success, but effects to interact with the spirit fail unless the effect's counteract level is higher than that of rest eternal or originates from an artifact or a deity.

Failure The ritual has no effect.

Critical Failure The ritual fails, and the spirits you appealed to are angered by your meddling. All casters become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} for 1 week.

entries.name: レストレーション
entries.description:
クリーチャーが最善の働きをするのを妨げるような毒の効果や状態を、回復の魔法が無効化する。君がレストレーションを発動する際、状態の減少か、毒の効果の軽減を選ぶこと。クリーチャーは毎日、一回のレストレーション呪文からしか利益を得ることが出来ず、同じ暴露で受けている毒のステージを減少するために、2回以上、レストレーションの利益を得ることはない。

  • 毒の軽減 対象が苦しめられている一つの毒のステージを減少させる。これによって、1未満にステージが減少することや、苦難が回復されることはない
  • 状態の減少 対象の@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{もたつき}、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{衰弱}、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{知性低下}の値を2減少させる。君は代わりに、記載されている状態2つの値を1ずつ減少させることが出来る。

増強 (4th) 君が減少させることが出来る状態の表に@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{吸精}を追加する。君が毒を軽減する際、ステージを2減少させる。君はまた、対象の@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{危篤状態}の値を1減少させるという三つ目の選択肢を得る。

増強 (6th) 4レベルのレストレーションと同じだが、君は、「呪文の発動」の際に、コストとして100gp相当のダイアモンドを使いながら、呪文発動アクションを一つ増やし、物質要素を追加するなら、永続的な危篤状態を減少することが出来る。

entries.name: 再生の瞬間
entries.description: 君は対象の周囲の時間の糸を操作し、1日の経過による利益を与える。対象は、持っているあらゆる@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{危篤}と@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{吸精}状態を1減少させ、即座に、1日以下の長さを持つステージの苦難それぞれに対して1回のセーヴィング・スローを行うことが出来る。対象はそれから、1日、この呪文に一時的完全耐性を得る。

entries.name: リストア・センシズ
entries.description:
対象に@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{盲目}あるいは@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{聴覚喪失}状態を与えている一つの効果を君は無効化し、その視覚か聴覚を回復しようとする。これによって一時的な魔法と永続的な魔法の結果の両方を無効化することが出来るが、生まれながらのものや魔法のものでない傷や毒によるものなど、自然の状態や効果によって感覚を持っていないものを治療することは出来ない。

増強 (6th) 呪文の距離は30フィートに増加し、君は10体までのクリーチャーを対象に取ることが出来る。君はそれぞれのクリーチャーについて無効化する効果を個別に選ぶことが出来る。

entries.name: リスタイル
entries.description: 君は永続的に、現在、君か味方が着用している1枚の衣類を、君の美的センスによりよく合致するように見た目を変化させる。君はその色彩、触感、模様、その他のそのデザインの微細な部分を変更することが出来るが、その変化は衣類の全体的な形状、大きさ、目的を変更することは出来ない。この辺かによって、その衣類の職人性や芸術性を増すことは出来ないが、新しい色や柄を選ぶ際に、特に派手な選択をすると、その美的魅力が損なわれる可能性がある。この呪文は、既存の素材を希望の外観に変えるものであり、素材を変えたり、元々、物体の一部であったものよりも多くの素材を作ることはない。また、物体のステータスも変化することはない。

entries.name: Resurrect
entries.description:
You attempt to call forth the target's soul and return it to its body. This requires the target's body to be present and relatively intact. The target must have died within the past year. If @Compendium[pf2e.deities.QZD0u1jxwz0kj8uI]{Pharasma} has decided that the target's time has come or the target doesn't wish to return, this ritual automatically fails, but you discover this after the successful Religion check and can end the ritual without paying the cost.

Critical Success You resurrect the target. They return to life with full Hit Points and the same spells prepared and points in their pools they had when they died, and still suffering from any long-term debilitations of the old body. The target meets an agent of their deity during the resurrection who inspires them, granting them a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception, saving throws, and skill checks for 1 week. The target is also permanently changed in some way by their time in the afterlife, such as gaining a slight personality shift, a streak of white in the hair, or a strange new birthmark.

Success As critical success, except the target returns to life with 1 Hit Point and no spells prepared or points in any pools, and still is affected by any long-term debilitations of the old body. Instead of inspiring them, the character's time in the Boneyard has left them temporarily debilitated. The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 week; these conditions can't be removed or reduced by any means until the week has passed.

Failure Your attempt is unsuccessful.

Critical Failure Something goes horribly wrong-an evil spirit possesses the body, the body transforms into a special kind of undead, or some worse fate befalls the target.

増強 (6th) You can resurrect a target of up to 12th level, and the base cost is 125 gp.

増強 (7th) You can use resurrect even with only a small portion of the body; the ritual creates a new body on a success or critical success. The target must have died within the past decade. The ritual requires four secondary casters, each of whom must be at least half the target's level. The target can be up to 14th level, and the base cost is 200 gp.

増強 (8th) As 7th level, but the target can be up to 16th level and the base cost is 300 gp.

増強 (9th) You can use resurrect even without the body as long as you know the target's name and have touched a portion of its body at any time. The target must have died within the past century, and it doesn't gain the negative conditions on a success. The ritual requires eight secondary casters, each of whom must be at least half the target's level. The target can be up to 18th level, and the base cost is 600 gp.

増強 (10th) As 9th level, except it doesn't matter how long ago the target died. The ritual requires 16 secondary casters, each of whom must be at least half the target's level. The target can be up to 20th level, and the ritual's base cost is 1,000 gp.

entries.name: 応報の痛み
entries.description:
トリガー 距離内のクリーチャーが君にダメージを与える

君は君を痛めつけた者に復讐し、痛みを跳ね返す。対象は呪文のトリガーとなった際に君に与えた量の半分に等しい精神ダメージを受ける。

entries.name: Retrocognition
entries.description:
Opening your mind to occult echoes, you gain impressions from past events that occurred in your current location. Retrocognition reveals psychic impressions from events that occurred over the course of the last day throughout the first minute of the duration, followed by impressions from the next day back the next minute, and so on. These echoes don't play out like a vision but instead reveal impressions of emotions and metaphors that provide cryptic clues and details of the past. If you witness a traumatic or turbulent event through an impression, the spell ends unless you succeed at a Will save with a DC of at least 30 and possibly as much as 50, depending on the severity of the event. The GM determines whether an event is traumatic and chooses the DC.

増強 (8th) You gain impressions of events that occurred over the previous year for each minute you concentrate, instead of the previous day, though the details diminish, making it harder to distinguish impressions from all but the most major events.

増強 (9th) You gain impressions of events that occurred over the previous century for each minute you concentrate, instead of the previous day, though the details diminish, making it almost impossible to distinguish impressions from all but the most major events.

entries.name: Return Beacon
entries.description:
You create a unique planar beacon somewhere within the spell's range that remains in place. The beacon is invisible except when detected by detect magic, in which case it looks like a 10-foot-wide tower of bright light stretching into the sky. At any time during the duration of the beacon, you can complete a 1-minute activity, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits, to focus on the beacon and transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to the location of the beacon. Transporting yourself in this way ends the spell. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the beacon collapses, ending the spell, and the transportation attempt fails.

Casting return beacon while a beacon is active causes the previous return beacon spell to end. If you are not within 1 mile of the beacon, your attempt to transport yourself to the beacon fails. If a solid object is in the same space as the beacon when you transport yourself, you arrive in the nearest open space to the beacon. If there is not an open space within 30 feet of the beacon, your attempt to transport yourself fails, but the beacon remains intact.

増強 (7th) The duration is 8 hours and you can transport yourself to the beacon from up to 100 miles away.

増強 (8th) The duration is 24 hours and you can transport yourself to the beacon from up to 1,000 miles away. In addition, you can bring 1 willing ally you touch with you when you transport to the beacon.

増強 (9th) The duration is 1 week and you can transport yourself to the beacon from anywhere on the same plane. In addition, you can bring up to 4 willing allies you touch with you when you transport to the beacon.

増強 (10th) The duration is unlimited and you can transport yourself to the beacon from any distance, even across other planes. In addition, you can bring up to 8 willing allies you touch when you transport to the beacon.

entries.name: Return To Essence
entries.description:
You unravel the magic of a spell that affects a container, door, or lock, converting it into energy you can repurpose to power your own spells.

Attempt a counteract check against the target spell or magical effect that wards or seals a doorway or chest, such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr]{Lock}, or against a spell or effect that deals damage or delivers secondary effects when it's opened, such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Glyph of Warding}. If you succeed, you recover its energy, restoring one of your expended spell slots of 3rd level or lower.

増強 (8th) You can restore an expended spell slot of 4th level or lower.

増強 (9th) You can restore an expended spell slot of 5th level or lower.

増強 (10th) You can restore an expended spell slot of 6th level or lower.

entries.name: Reverse Gravity
entries.description: You reverse gravity in the area. Creatures and objects that aren't secured to the ground immediately fall upward to the top of the area. A creature might be able to Grab an Edge to arrest its fall if it falls past an appropriate surface. If a creature falls against a solid object (such as a ceiling), it takes the appropriate amount of falling damage and lands on the surface. Once an object or creature reaches the top of the area, it floats, caught between the normal and reversed gravity. The creature can move along the plane where the two forms of gravity meet. Creatures that can levitate or fly can use those abilities to mitigate the effects of reverse gravity.When reverse gravity ends, all creatures and objects caught in the area fall back down. Likewise, anything that moves beyond the spell's area is subjected to normal gravity again.

entries.name: Revival
entries.description:
A burst of healing energy soothes living creatures and temporarily rouses those recently slain. All living targets regain 10d8+40 Hit Points.

In addition, you return any number of dead targets to life temporarily, with the same effects and limitations as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead}. The raised creatures have a number of temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points you gave living creatures, but no normal Hit Points. The raised creatures can't regain Hit Points or gain temporary Hit Points in other ways, and once revival's duration ends, they lose all temporary Hit Points and die.

Revival can't resurrect creatures killed by disintegrate or a death effect. It has no effect on undead.

entries.name: Rewinding Step
entries.description:
You anchor your location in time so that you can swiftly retrace your steps later with complex chronomancy. The space you're in when you cast the spell becomes your temporal anchor space. While you're within 500 feet of your temporal anchor space, you can spend a single action that has the concentrate trait to instantaneously return to that space (you don't need to have line of effect to the space). The spell then ends. You bring any items that are in your possession with you when you take the action to return.

If the anchor space is occupied when you attempt to return to it or if this spell would bring another creature with you, the spell fails to transport you, then ends.

増強 (7th) You can return if you're within 1,000 feet of your anchor space.

増強 (9th) You can return if you're within 1 mile of your anchor space.

entries.name: Righteous Might
entries.description:
You focus all your divine energy and transform yourself into a Medium battle form, similar to your normal form but armed with powerful divine armaments granted by your deity. While in this form, you gain the statistics and abilities listed below. You have hands in this battle form and can use manipulate actions. You can Dismiss the spell.

You gain the following statistics and abilities:

  • AC = 20 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction.
  • 10 temporary Hit Points.
  • Speed 40 feet.
  • Resistance 3 against physical damage.
  • Darkvision.
  • A special attack with a righteous armament version of your favored weapon, which is the only attack you can use. Your attack modifier with the special weapon is +21, and your damage bonus is +8 (or +6 for a ranged attack). If your attack modifier with your deity's favored weapon is higher, you can use it instead. You deal three of your weapon's normal damage dice, or three damage dice of one size larger if your weapon is a simple weapon with a d4 or d6 damage die. The weapon has one of the following properties that matches your deity's alignment: anarchic, axiomatic, holy, unholy. If your deity is true neutral, you instead deal an extra 1d6 precision damage.
  • Athletics modifier of +23, unless your own modifier is higher.

増強 (8th) Your battle form is Large, and your attacks have 10-foot reach, or 15-foot reach if your deity's favored weapon has reach. You must have enough space to expand into or the spell is lost. You instead gain AC = 21 + your level, 15 temporary HP, resistance 4 against physical damage, attack modifier +28, damage bonus +15 (+12 for a ranged attack), and Athletics +29.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.W4lb3417rNDd9tCq]{Spell Effect: Righteous Might}

entries.name: ライム・スリック
entries.description:
君は凍てつく風を呼び起こす。君がこの“呪文の発動”を行う際、範囲内のそれぞれのクリーチャーに君は2d4点の氷雪ダメージを与える（基本反応セーヴ）。もし、範囲内の一体のクリーチャーが反応セーヴにファンブルし、立っていたのなら、そのクリーチャーは@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{伏せ状態}にもなる。

君はまた、範囲内の全ての地表に氷の層を作り出し、移動困難な地形にすることも出来る。範囲内の誰にも管理されていない物体は氷で滑り、それらを拾い上げるには君の呪文DCに対する反応セーヴか〈軽業〉判定の成功が必要になる。より高いレベルの、火の特性を持つ呪文や効果の範囲に含まれる全てのマス目と、火炎ダメージを受けたあらゆる物体の氷は溶ける。

増強 (5th) ダメージは8d4氷雪ダメージに上昇し、範囲は30フィート爆発になる

増強 (8th) ダメージは14d4氷雪ダメージに上昇し、範囲は60フィート爆発になる

entries.name: Rip the Spirit
entries.description:
You supernaturally rip the spirit from a living creature's body, dooming the target to pain and death. The target takes 5d6 negative damage, depending on its basic Fortitude save, and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} if it fails its save. The spell's effect is based on how many actions you spend when Casting the Spell.

1 (somatic) The spell targets one living creature in range.

2 (somatic, verbal) The spell targets one living creature in range and the damage is [[/r {10d6}[negative]]]{10d6 negative damage} instead of 5d6.

3 (material, somatic, verbal) The spell targets all living creatures in a 30-foot emanation.

増強 (+1) The amount of damage increases by 1d6, or by [[/r 2d6]] for the 2-action version.

entries.name: Rising Surf
entries.description:
You create a wave of water that you ride, banking around obstacles and surfing to higher ground. You move up to 35 feet, raising yourself up to 5 feet above the ground. (You can avoid many types of difficult terrain in this way.) You must end your movement on an unoccupied space where you have solid footing. This movement isn't a Stride, but you measure the distance in a similar way, and it still triggers reactions caused by movement. You can't transport anyone else with you.

増強 (+2) Increase the distance you move by 5 feet and the maximum height traveled above the ground by 5 feet.

entries.name: Rite of the Red Star
entries.description:
You invoke the latent power within the Doorway to the Red Star through repetitive chanting and ritual movements in an attempt to open a portal to the planet Akiton.

Critical Success The plaza hums with magical energy that vibrates bones, causes hair to rise as if in a static field, and graces the tongue with flavors both unbearably sweet and terribly foul. The crimson pillars of the Doorway itself begin to smoke, then shimmer with red light, while the air within the ring shifts and ripples as if in the throes of intense heat. A moment later, a portal to Akiton opens at the center of the standing stones. This portal is vertical and semi-circular, with a radius of 30 feet, and is filled with shimmering red energy-it doesn't provide a view of the other side. Any caster who steps through this portal is instantly transported to area B1 of the Hall of Reason on Akiton.

Success As critical success, but the portal's magic is distressed and unstable. When a caster steps through the portal, they must attempt a Fortitude save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} from the stress of the magical journey.

Failure The portal fails to open, and all casters must attempt a Fortitude save to avoid becoming drained 1 from the backlash of magical energy.

Critical Failure As failure, but the misfire attracts the attention of a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.qjAtPDIi7OyUGsNy]{Bythos} aeon which appears in the area at once and attempts to destroy the stones of the Doorway. After one round of attacks, it realizes the portal is beyond its ability to damage, and attempts to slay those who attempted to activate the portal in the first place.

entries.name: Roar of the Wyrm
entries.description:
You channel the might of dragons into your voice, letting out a roar that engenders respect in dragonkind but that instills fear in most other creatures.

The impressive roar grants you a @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.0s6YaL3IjqECmjab]{+2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks} for 10 minutes against dragons that were in the area at the time of casting. All enemies within the area other than dragons must attempt a Will save; to these enemies, roar of the wyrm is a fear effect.

Roar of the wyrm affects non-dragon creatures with deep ties to dragonkind (such as a barbarian with the draconic instinct, a sorcerer with the draconic bloodline, or a member of a culture that reveres dragons) as if they had the dragon trait. The GM decides if a creature is aligned enough with dragonkind to be affected in this way.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

entries.name: ロアリング・アプローズ
entries.description:
君の派手な演出は観客の感情を揺さぶり、歓声や拍手を引き起こす。この呪文の対象は、君を目視するか、聞き取るか、そうでなければ君を理解することが出来ていなければならない。対象は意志セーヴを試みなくてはならない。

クリティカル 対象は影響を受けない

成功 対象は君の見せるものに軽く気を取られて、完全には意識を取られていないものの、拍手をする。リアクションを使うことが出来なくなる

失敗 対象はリアクションを使うことが出来ず、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{減速化1}になるほど精力的に君に拍手喝采をする。この拍手は非常にのめり込んだものなので、操作の特性を持つ。これは、対象の手番の開始時に操作の特性に基づいたリアクションのトリガーとなる。

ファンブル 失敗と同じだが、対象は君に気を取られ、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{恍惚}状態になるほど精力的に君に拍手喝采をする

増強 (6th) 君は10体までのクリーチャーを対象にすることが出来る

entries.name: Rope Trick
entries.description:
You cause the target rope to rise vertically into the air. Where it ends, an extradimensional space opens, connected to the top of the rope. This space can be reached only by climbing the rope.

The entrance to the space can't be seen, and it can be pinpointed only by the presence of the rope. The rope can't be removed or hidden, though it can be detached from the extradimensional space by pulling it with 16,000 pounds of weight, critically succeeding at an Athletics check against the spell's DC, or destroying the rope. The space holds up to eight Medium creatures and their gear. A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, a Huge creature counts as four Medium creatures, and a Gargantuan creature fills the space on its own.

If the rope is detached or destroyed, or if a creature attempts to enter the space that would put it over its capacity, the space begins to unravel. It disappears in [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, depositing the creatures within safely on the ground below.

entries.name: ロウズ・スケルトンズ
entries.description:
石畳のような硬い表面から不格好な骸骨が吹き出してきて、爆発内を埋め尽くす。彼らが満たす範囲は移動困難な地形となる。掴もうとしてくる爪によって、骸骨が最初に現れた際、範囲内の地表にいるクリーチャーは2d6点の斬撃ダメージを受ける（基本反応セーヴ）

その後のラウンドでは、ラウンドごとに最初に「呪文の維持」をするごとに、君は呪文の範囲内に骸骨の範囲を20フィートまで移動させ、新しい範囲内に居るクリーチャーそれぞれに2d6点の斬撃ダメージ（基本反応セーヴ）を与えることが出来る。

骸骨にダメージを与えたり、破壊することは全く影響を与えない。消滅した者を置き換え、修復するために新しい骨が地面から引き出されてくるからである。

増強 (+2) ダメージは1d6点、上昇する。

entries.name: ルーンの予想図
entries.description:
この呪文を発動した際に、君の素手打撃あるいは武器は、君が選んだ武器ルーンの利益を得る：コローシヴ、フレイミング、フロスト、ゴースト＝タッチ、リターニング、ショック、サンダリングから選ぶこと。もし、ルーンの予想図を武器に発動したなら、君が武器を持つことをやめれば呪文は終了する。この呪文が武器に、通常の最大値より多い属性ルーンを与えるなら、既存の属性ルーンの1つ（君が選ぶ）は呪文が終了するまで抑制される。素手打撃の場合、もし、この呪文が君のハンドラップス・オヴ・マイティ・ブロウズが持てるよりも多い属性ルーンを与えるようであれば、既存の属性ルーンの1つが同様に抑制される。

増強（8レベル） キーン、グレーターのコローシヴ、フレイミング、フロスト、ショック、サンダリングを選択できるリストに加える

メモ: 混成呪文は「呪文撃」をリチャージする

entries.name: Rusting Grasp
entries.description:
You cause the target to rapidly rust. This magical rust can affect nonferrous materials, but the target must be all or mostly metal. Skymetals such as adamantine and orichalcum are immune to this rust, and the GM might determine other precious materials are similarly resilient. Ultimately, the GM decides if an object or creature can be targeted with this spell. All damage from this spell ignores Hardness. If the spell causes persistent damage from rust, a creature can attempt to scrape off the rust to assist the target in recovering from the persistent damage (reducing the DC of the flat check to end persistent damage to 10 and granting an immediate flat check). The effect of the spell depends on its target.

•Creature or Hazard A creature or hazard must be made of all or mostly metal to be affected (this includes many mechanical traps). It takes [[/r 8d6]] damage (basic Fortitude save), plus [[/r 2d6 #persistent]] pe@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage} on a failed save. Touching a hazard to affect it with this spell might trigger the hazard, as determined by the GM.

•Item The rust deals [[/r 2d6]] damage, subject to a basic Reflex save by the creature wearing or holding the item; if the item is unattended, it automatically gets a critical failure. On a failed save, the item also takes [[/r 1d6 #persistent]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage}.
